prompt:
You are an AI interviewer. Your candidate's name is ADITYA SUTHAR. They are applying for the position of Machine learning.
Generate exactly 3 technical interview questions numbered 1 through 3. Do NOT include any introduction or conclusion. ONLY provide the numbered questions, one per line, starting with '1. ' and so on. All questions must be technical and directly relevant to the Machine learning role.

responses.question: How would you handle class imbalance in a binary classification problem, where one class has a significantly larger number of instances compared to the other class, and what techniques would you employ to ensure that the model doesn't get biased towards the dominant class?

Suppose you're training a neural network on a dataset that contains both categorical and numerical features, what encoding methodologies would you employ for the categorical variables, and how would you integrate them into the neural network architecture, alongside the numerical features?
responses.answer: I don't know it will answer this following question.

responses.question: You're tasked with developing a recommender system based on collaborative filtering, and you have access to user-item interaction data, where users have rated items on a scale of 1 to 5. How would you construct the user-item interaction matrix, and what techniques would you employ to factorize the matrix in order to predict missing ratings and generate personalized recommendations?
responses.answer: I don't know the answer of the following question.
